subdisciplines.name: Schenkerian analysis
subdisciplines.description: A method of analyzing tonal music through the use of voice-leading graphs and reductions that focus on underlying harmonic and contrapuntal structures.

subdisciplines.name: Neo-Riemannian theory
subdisciplines.description: A model of tonal harmony which emphasizes the transformational relationships between chords and their inversions.

subdisciplines.name: Formal analysis
subdisciplines.description: The study of the structure of a piece of music, often examining the relationships between individual sections to reveal larger-scale patterns.
